entry.title: M123 merge request for crrev.com/c/5310859
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5277072 caused an unexpected screen color issue on some ChromeOS devices.
Reference for details in Buganizer: - https://b.corp.google.com/issues/326134132 - https://b.corp.google.com/issues/321593582
It's confirmed that the revert fixes the issue and is merged in main branch: https://crrev.com/c/5310859, and we also need it to be in M123: https://crrev.com/c/5315480.

entry.title: Tests are failing: webgpu_cts_integration_test_base.py(371): AssertionError: webgpu:web_platform,external_texture,video:importExternalTexture,compute:videoName=\"four...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): webgpu_cts_integration_test_base.py(371): AssertionError: webgpu:web_platform,external_texture,video:importExternalTexture,compute:videoName="four-colors-h264-bt601-rotate-90.mp4";sourceType="VideoElement";dstColorSpace="srgb" failed
 - EXPECTATION FAILED: Texture level had unexpected contents:
 between 0,0,0 and 1,1,0 inclusive:
 coords == X,Y,Z: 0,0,0 0,1,0 1,0,0 ...
 act. texel bytes (little-endian) == 0x: f8 24 00 ff 3f fb 00 ff fe fd 00 ff ...
 act. colors == R,G,B,A: 0.972549,0.141176,0.00000,1.00000 0.247059,0.984314,0.00000,1.00000 0.996078,0.992157,0.00000,1.00000 ...
 exp. colors == R,G,B,A: 0.996078,0.992157,0.00000,1.00000 0.972549,0.141176,0.00000,1.00000 0.101961,0.137255,1.00000,1.00000 ...
 act. normal-ULPs-from-zero == R,G,B,A: ...
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgpu_cts_integration_test.WebGpuCtsIntegrationTest.webgpu:web_platform,external_texture,video:importExternalTexture,compute:videoName="four-colors-h264-bt601-rotate-90.mp4";sourceType="VideoElement";dstColorSpace="srgb"
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/2a347cddc1607f55424f396c65bca339
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Support add account button in button flow modal
Support back button in button flow modal
Notifications from service workers appear in separate profiles
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create two Chromium profiles, A and B 2. In profile A, launch a web app that installs a service worker and sends notifications (e.g. Tinder) 3. Exit Chromium 4. Launch Chromium with profile B 5. Wait until you see unrelated notifications from service workers registered with profile A
# Problem Description This can be a security issue. Also, at startup, the profile picker shows this text, creating the expectio of complete separation:
"With Chromium profiles you can separate all your Chromium stuff."
# Summary Notifications from service workers appear in separate profiles
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Google chrome widevine screen recording
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Play widevine L3 DRM encrypted video in google chrome
# Problem Description Google chrome was able to restrict screen recording of widevine L3 encrypted videos in windows and mac. We are using this to prevent content piracy from last 3 years. After the latest chrome update, google chrome is not able to restrict screen recording of widevine L3 videos. But microsoft edge is able to restrict screen recording of widevine L3 videos.
Since microsoft edge is able to restrict and google chrome is not able to restrict, it does not look like a widevine defect but a chrome defect. Also problem is happening in google chrome in latest versions.
This issue is happening in windows-10/windows-11 and mac.
Please fix this issue as many services are depending on this feature for preventing screen capture.
# Additional Comments Please note that with hardware acceleration disabled, google chrome will not restrict screen recording in older versions also. This defect I raised is for hardware acceleration enabled
# Summary Google chrome widevine screen recording
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Last visited bookmark folder is only recalled for local or syncable
entry.content: If you visit a bookmark folder, tap done, and open the bookmarks again, you’re supposed to go back to the previously opened folder. This is not the case in the account model, only in the local or syncable model.

entry.title: Resource ID #0x2100004android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0x2100004
entry.content:
Android device name: CPH2359、CPH2213、RMX3085、CPH2251、CPH2249
Android OS version: 13、14
Android System WebView version: com.google.android.webview version 121.0.6167.143 (code 616714333)
Application: com.coloros.phonemanager
Application version:14.6.0、14.5.0
Steps to reproduce: Not sure yet. It's reported by our crash collector From event log, usually like this：
02-09 18:08:11.893 1574 1636 I am_proc_start: [0,8250,10109,com.coloros.phonemanager,content provider,{com.coloros.phonemanager/com.coloros.phonemanager.virusdetect.provider.RiskDataInternalProvider}] 02-09 18:08:11.921 1574 2302 I am_proc_bound: [0,8250,com.coloros.phonemanager] 02-09 18:08:12.949 1574 1636 I am_proc_start: [0,8396,99009,com.google.android.webview:sandboxed_process0:org.chromium.content.app.SandboxedProcessService0:0,,{com.coloros.phonemanager/org.chromium.content.app.SandboxedProcessService0:0}] 02-09 18:08:14.061 8453 8453 I auditd : type=1400 audit(0.0:1444): avc: denied { ptrace } for comm="linker64" scontext=u:r:priv_app:s0:c512,c768 tcontext=u:r:priv_app:s0:c512,c768 tclass=process permissive=0 app=com.coloros.phonemanager 02-09 18:08:14.138 1574 8197 I am_crash: [8250,0,com.coloros.phonemanager,819510853,android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException,Resource ID #0x2100004,ResourcesImpl.java,266] 02-09 18:08:14.225 1574 2781 I am_proc_died: [0,8250,com.coloros.phonemanager,905,10]
Expected result: No crash
Actual result: Crash
Stacktrace： Resource ID #0x2100004android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0x2100004 at android.content.res.ResourcesImpl.getValue(ResourcesImpl.java:268) at android.content.res.ResourcesImpl.openRawResource(ResourcesImpl.java:388) at android.content.res.Resources.openRawResource(Resources.java:1406) at android.content.res.Resources.openRawResource(Resources.java:1350) at WV.Sq.(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-609919333:12) at WV.AB.(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-609919333:18) at org.chromium.android_webview.AwBrowserProcess.g(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-609919333:106) at com.android.webview.chromium.M.e(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-609919333:208) at WV.OX.run(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-609919333:8) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:958) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:257) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:368) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:8815) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(RuntimeInit.java:572) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1049)

entry.title: Fragmentation doesn't propagate changes to nested subgrids
Wildcards permitted contrary to documentation for some policies
entry.content:
On Linux with Chromium 124.0.6315.0 ToT
Some content setting URL pattern policies claim to not support wildcards, but apparently do via linux test_policy.json
$ grep -E WILDCARD_VALUE.*not components/policy/resources/templates/policy_definitions/ContentSettings/*AllowedFor* ... $ sudo gedit /etc/chromium/policies/managed/test_policy.json { "AutomaticFullscreenAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "WindowManagementAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ],
"ClipboardAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "CookiesAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "FileHandlingAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "ImagesAllowedForUrl": [ "*" ], "InsecureContentAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "JavaScriptAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites": [ "*" ], "KeygenAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "NotificationsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "PopupsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "SensorsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "WebPrintingAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], }
chrome://policy reports many "OK" (JSON attached), page info and site settings show "Allowed by your administrator" (screenshots attached), and quick manual testing confirms a couple.
I recall adding "Wildcards, <ph name="WILDCARD_VALUE">*</ph>, are allowed." for WindowManagement*ForUrls policies, based on similar manual experimentation: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/policy/resources/templates/policy_definitions/ContentSettings/WindowManagementAllowedForUrls.yaml#:~:text=Wildcards%2C%20%3Cph%20name%3D%22WILDCARD_VALUE%22%3E*%3C/ph%3E%2C%20are%20allowed.
What's the best practice? Should new per-origin content setting or permission policies allow wildcards? Should we update any existing documentation or resolve any potential enforcement gaps?

entry.title: mac-angle-chromium-try is too flaky
entry.content:
https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try?limit=200
This trybot is too flaky. I'm seeing unrelated CLs like https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/angle/angle/+/5315376 be rejected twice in a row due to different flakes.
Example failures:
webgl2_conformance_gl_passthrough_ganesh_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: deqp/functional/gles3/fboinvalidate/sub.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22928/overview * Caused by a random GL error causing an assertion failure in the GPU process
webgl_conformance_metal_passthrough_graphite_tests on AMD GPU on Mac Retina failed because of: deqp/data/gles2/shaders/conversions_vector_to_vector.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22854/overview * Caused by a flake in rendering
webgl_conformance_gl_passthrough_ganesh_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: conformance/more/conformance/quickCheckAPI-B1.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22921/overview * Caused by a renderer process timeout
webgl_conformance_metal_passthrough_ganesh_tests on AMD GPU on Mac Retina failed because of: conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-1-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-2-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-3-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-4-of-8.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22880/overview * Caused by multiple 30-second timeouts (apparently not caused by hung renderers)
webgl2_conformance_metal_passthrough_graphite_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: conformance/extensions/oes-texture-float-linear.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22922/overview * Caused by a GPU process crash inside the Metal validation layers
I'm not sure where to begin to get this bot back to an acceptable level of stability. Flakes are happening across Intel/AMD, Ganesh/Graphite, GL/Metal, etc.
Do others have ideas?
My first instinct would be to turn off parallelism within each shard for these Intel-based Macs and see if that improves things.

entry.title: Enable Python formatting in Catapult
entry.content: Currently, Python formatting is inconsistently applied in the Catapult project. In order to improve code readability and unblock use of Python type hinting, we want to enable Python formatting everywhere other than third party code.

entry.title: ☂️ Bring Python type hinting to Catapult
entry.content:
Umbrella bug for bringing Python type hinting to Catapult.
Desing doc is go/catapult-python-type-hinting-dd

entry.title: BookmarkImageFetcher doesn't use PowerBookmarkMeta image
entry.content: When fetching images, if there's PowerBookmarkMeta available then the image there should be used instead of Optimization Guide.

entry.title: Fix broken app icons on chrome://apps due to CSP policy
entry.content: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293074 introduced stricter CSP policies that do not take chrome://app-icon URLs into account, breaking all app icons on chrome://apps and chrome://app-settings/ page. Fix that by overriding the content security policy for images.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: OS-level audio controls only mute the last active tab
entry.content:
When multiple tabs are open playing music (e.g. open.spotify.com and youtube.com), OS level audio controls to mute sound on macOS and Windows only affect the last active tab with audio, leaving previous tabs still playing.
Mac screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/iV5QYmSiichyUgU.png Win screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/47p83JhDb9LNrwj.png

entry.title: ICU update script is no longer valid
entry.content:
To roll ICU, there is an [update script](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/icu/scripts/update.sh) that uses SVN to fetch the upstream ICU library from github.
Github has deprecated SVN on 1/8/2024. https://github.blog/2023-01-20-sunsetting-subversion-support/ which breaks the update script.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: unable to change folder name after creating new folder in side panel
entry.content:
Click Chromenu --> Click show all bookmarks --> click edit --> select a bookmark --> click move --> click new folder --> is there a way to change the folder's name when you create a new folder?
Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9vs5HNgWrhGjvFD
Assigning to Aina to investigate further and provide a spec if necessary.

entry.title: Can android-internal-dbg or android-internal-rel run base_unittests?
entry.content: While trying to repro a CI bot test failure, I found that there's no CQ bot with a matching config to run the test in question (JniByteBuffer.ConversionFromNonBuffer) since it's part of base_unittests.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: Smoother animations during pinch-to-zoom
entry.content:
Possible to support nicer easing/overall animation when zooming in/out? Especially for trackpad users. Zooming today feels really janky and stuttery. Users should be able to quickly pinch on the trackpad to zoom without the animation failing and zoom event not happening. Compare to Safari where this is done well.
Erik, could you help route to the right owner to investigate further? Also, wasn't sure which component to use so please update that if needed. Thanks!
